topic.title: [Multi-Platform Software] Syncthing 0.14.3
topic.body:
Syncthing replaces proprietary sync and cloud services with something open, trustworthy and decentralized. Your data is your data alone and you deserve to choose where it is stored, if it is shared with some third party and how it's transmitted over the Internet.
Syncthing is secure because it uses TLS for communication within computers so you dont have to worry for your files to be stolen while syncing.
Syncthing is Open-Source and Free to use, is an easy app to use and it has a third-party app for Android and F-Droid.
Thanks to testset for passing me this app, I give him the credit for sharing this awesome cloud app.
Page: https://syncthing.net/
Source-Code Page: https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing

topic.title: IZR Vision
topic.body:
The primary aim of ISR is that everyone everywhere will always be able to access important software for their day to day life. This means that if the videolan website dies forever, or for some reason is compromised (think hackers or censorship), there will always be at least one verified genuine installer for VLC on ISR.
The secondary reason is more due to the hacker/censorship/NSA sort of thing. We hope (yes, just hope) that the software we all know and love is not compromised at the moment. We can support this hope by the fact the many people across the world are using the same file as us. The reason this makes us feel better is that if, say, the NSA built a backdoor into bitmessage, they likely wouldn't do that for servers outside the US. Instead, they would more likely just redirect US website visitors to their own page, complete with compromised download.
This is why the file hashing is important. It tells us that we aren't being sent a fake file (or at least everyone is, but we hope that's less likely). For all intents and purposes, going to the official site to download might still be a good idea if you are able. Then take that link and cross check the hash against our table.

As for the target audience, I'd say most people on zeronet. That is to say that people who have tech-backgrounds or maybe some concept of cybersecurity? Of course by no means do you need that to use our service, but much of our software centers around that.

So to summarize, ISR is here to make sure everybody is able to get their hands on untampered important software.

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_23_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): Yeah I find that mining Satoshi points in order to get a Bitcoin payout every Sunday is too laborious. So I tried going to a Bitcoin ATM machine today to buy some Bitcoin anonymously. But turns out my phone just had a picture of the QR code and the code was not linked to a Bitcoin wallet on my phone. So the ATM machine did not recognise my bitcoin address and let me buy bitcoins. So i'll try again tomorrow lol
> The ATM type I encountered was a Lamassu Bitcoin ATM. But the camera was not recognising my Bitcoint public key QR code. Probably because I just right-clicked and saved the image of the QR code from Warpwallet but did not link it to a Bitcoin wallet(?). I dont know.

i dont know lol, if you need a qr code tell me and i make you easily a wallet :P

4_17VwZEfWSUWb5RHkK9m1odnDdBfvjTL6Cp.body:
I could do a json compatible program with Java that detects differences when you click the button Update in ZeroHello. Edit: This ^ is about the alert system about someone is sending bad data
About a database, I have a site (www.minesys.tk(you cant search for my name because it has whois protection haha)) but I tried making 000webhost compatible with cloudflare and I CANT DO IT! but 000webhost gives me a MySQL database for my website ^^.
Then the next thing it would be cool to see if they want to install an App with some github api that detects hashes, each time they download some of the apps, they execute the app and the app itself detects all the hashes, compares it to an MySQL database (the database I have in my site) and if they are all correct it says "All the apps were verified and they have the same hash" or if its not "All the apps were verified and some of the hashes are different.
Name of the apps:
name
name
"
All the verified information goes to this page or somewhere else and says that its trusted or no.
We can make the app before sending the data to the page to submit a form, if they dont do it you can do whatever you want with the information you got.
I know a hash app that is used in Hiren's Mini Windows XP


TOO MUCH THINGS!!!

OK lets deduce what technology uses chrome and chromium but not firefox now :/

Ok found error
If you grab the link and put it as a new tab the download starts
But if you just click it makes a new window of firefox where it doesnt download, thanks to Remote XUL I think.
zeroexef just needs to update the page html code where the download links open in a new tab.
edit: this repair just works for zip files. the ones that say windows, etc cant find the fix for it. Tried adding 127.0.0.1:43110 in Remote XUL Manager but still cant find the error.

quote from Remote Xul Manager in Firefox Addons
About this Add-on
Support for Remote XUL was removed on Firefox 4 (see bug 546857 for more information). But there's still a whitelist that enables Remote XUL, which can be edited using this add-on.
new thing, the one i can just download is gpg4usb zip but the others no, cant see diference between the others but I think it can help in the fix
I will just go to github and upload the error myself but Im sure this is an error in our html code.
